body_html:
@mrry So the latest gRPC strictly requires SSL through the census code. It might be possible to unravel by patching the code, but I'm not sure it's worth it.

I updated the CMake files to make boringssl required, and the build works (on Linux at least), but adds additional build-time dependencies for Windows. You can see that list here:
https://github.com/google/boringssl/blob/master/BUILDING.md

Since it's rare for people to build for Windows from scratch (they'd more likely use the package we build), should we just install those dependencies on our Windows machines and require boringssl from now on?

body:
@mrry So the latest gRPC strictly requires SSL through the census code. It might be possible to unravel by patching the code, but I'm not sure it's worth it.

I updated the CMake files to make boringssl required, and the build works (on Linux at least), but adds additional build-time dependencies for Windows. You can see that list here:
https://github.com/google/boringssl/blob/master/BUILDING.md

Since it's rare for people to build for Windows from scratch (they'd more likely use the package we build), should we just install those dependencies on our Windows machines and require boringssl from now on?
